author: mi-hol
body:
There are still many open issues in milestone 6.0.0-NiceToHave that I'd love to see included in 6.1.
What is the plan for them?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Plan is "nice to have" 😄 We want implement but _haven't resources_ - feel free to contribute or at least vote.

comments.author: mi-hol
comments.body:
ok start to understand :)
With 6.0.0 released, should the milestone not be renamed from '6.0.0-NiceToHave' to something like '6.x-NiceToHave'?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: For me it is ok. I'd rename only 6 -> 7 when the time comes.

comments.author: mi-hol
comments.body: @iSazonov is this list of issues not actually the Backlog?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I'd like to get rid of the `6.0.0-NiceToHave` milestone as it's no longer relevant.  Going forward, rather than putting a bunch of issues in 6.x only to move them to 6.x+1, all non-critical issues that we believe should be addressed will be in the `Future` milestone.  There is no guarantee *when* an issue will be fixed, but the more up votes the higher the priority (depending on risk of changes, even a high priority issue may not be fixed quickly).  I'll review all the current `6.0.0-NiceToHave` issues and will move them either to `Future` or no milestone (which means undetermined).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I believe if you reviewed an issue it is better assign it to a milestone in any case to indicate that you already reviewed. For "no milestone" it can be `No milestone`, `Undetermine` or `No plans`.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov that is a fair point.  cc @joeyaiello

title: Plan for open issues in milestone 6.0.0-NiceToHave?
